info.description:
behave-testsuite
================

You like unittest, right ? But you also use other test frameworks
because you feel one is not enough ? You are a fan of Behaviour-Based
Development but you feel lazy typing `behave` whenever you need it ?
Once you saw that doctest peasants had their own :code:`doctest.DocTestSuite`
and your world began to shatter ?

Fear no more. **behave-testsuite is here for you**.

|Travis| |Codacy| |Coverage| |PyPI| |License| |GitHub|

Usage
-----
Create a file in your test folder with the following content:

.. code:: python

    from behave_testsuite import *

    def load_tests(loader, tests, ignore):
        tests.addTests(BehaveTestSuite('path/to/some/features'))
        return tests


and **BAM!** your behaviour tests are now loaded by unittest whenever you
need it. Just like that. **behave-testsuite** creates independant TestCases
for each feature in the feature directory that unittest can load easily.

Installation
------------
Install with pip:

.. code:: bash

    pip install behave-testsuite        # install on whole system
    pip install behave-testsuite --user # install for user only


Advanced
--------
behave-testsuite supports most of the parameters that can be passed to:

.. code:: python

    # Only items with @one tag
    BehaveTestSuite('path/to/some/features', tags=['@one'])

    # Only items without @one tag
    BehaveTestSuite('path/to/some/features', tags=['~@one'])

    # Only items with either @one or @two
    BehaveTestSuite('path/to/some/features', tags=['@one,@two'])

    # Only items with both @one and @two
    BehaveTestSuite('path/to/some/features', tags=['@one', '@two'])
